hero.title: ‘Just Like Medicine’: A New Push for Divorce in a Nation Where It’s Illegal
hero.description: A campaign in the Philippines that frames divorce as a basic human right is gaining momentum, despite systemic and religious barriers.

primary.title: Filipinos flock to cemeteries for All Saints’ Day
primary.description: Despite the drizzle, thousands of Filipinos trooped to cemeteries on Wednesday to remember their dead on All Saints’ Day.

secondary.title: Sleeping at cemeteries and other Filipino All Souls Day traditions
secondary.description: Filipino traditions that are observed during All Souls Day include prayer, offering food to the dead, and sometimes, staying with them overnight.

secondary.title: ‘Undas’: Very Pinoy way of remembering the dead
secondary.description: Every year, a day after Halloween (or Hallow’s eve), in many countries, Nov. 1 is a public holiday to commemorate All Saints’ Day, with Nov. 2 also observed by those with Christian heritage as a holiday called All Souls’ Day.

secondary.title: 'Life is sacred': Undas cemetery visitors urged to be mindful of stray animals
secondary.description: A community of animal stray feeders advised cemetery visitors to be mindful of dogs and cats in the vicinities as Filipinos observe All Souls' Day today.

carousel.title: Nearly half of Filipino families feel poor: SWS
carousel.description: Almost half of Filipino families feel poor, according to a Social Weather Stations survey.

carousel.title: [Pastilan] Barangay elections 2023: Money, manipulation, and mayhem
carousel.description: 'What we just saw was a carnival of chaos, a festival of folly, and a reminder that when it comes to elections, we've still got a long way to go before we can truly call it a democratic process'

carousel.title: Exodus of nurses - Manila Standard
carousel.description: Don't look now, but we're likely to lose nearly 30,000 of our nurses to hospitals in the United States soon. That's because there's likely to be a fresh wave of mass migration of Filipino nurses seeking the proverbial greener pastures primarily to the United States.

carousel.title: Iloilo named 'Creative City of Gastronomy' by Unesco
carousel.description: Manila, Philippines: Iloilo City was named among the United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization's (Unesco) Creative Cities Network (UCCN), which was released on Tuesday, as part of World Cities Day.
